title: Understanding Thermodynamic Cycles
text: In a thermodynamic cycle, the system undergoes various processes and returns to its initial state. Consider the flow of energy and internal properties within the system.

title: Analyzing Enthalpy in Cycles
text: When analyzing cycles, remember that certain system properties like enthalpy, a state function, are path-independent. What happens to these properties when the system returns to its original state?

title: Relating State Functions and Processes
text: Even if a system undergoes irreversible and reversible processes, state functions like enthalpy depend only on initial and final states. What does this tell us about the change in enthalpy?

title: Updating System Properties
text: Given that the system returns to its original state, what can you say about the change in its enthalpy (ΔH) over the entire cycle?
